taxonomicnotes:
Described by Siebert (1991) based on types from Kalimantan. Rainboth (1996) considered it likely that the species is a synonym of Acanthopsoides hapalias Siebert 1991, as the species was differentiated from hapalias primarily by geographical distribution. Considered a valid species by subsequent authors.

Siebert (1991) suggests that the species may be a complex, and further taxonomic work is required.
rationale: The species has a wide distribution and is abundant where found. Confirmation is required of the taxonomic status of the species and sub-populations, as Rainboth (1996) considered it likely that the species is a synonym of Acanthopsoides hapalias Siebert 1991, as the species was differentiated from hapalias primarily by geographical distribution. Considered a valid species by subsequent authors, but Siebert (1991) suggests that the species may be a complex, and further taxonomic work is required. It is considered Least Concern at present however further taxonomic study is required to confirm the species' correct taxonomic placement, and its distribution if confirmed as a valid species.
evaluator: Kottelat, M., Vidthayanon, C. & Smith, K.
